mainBoard.flavorText: "There are two ways for me to pass this gate. One involves you remaining conscious." —Gerrard of the Weatherlight
mainBoard.name: Abyssal Gatekeeper
mainBoard.originalText: When Abyssal Gatekeeper is put into a graveyard from play, each player sacrifices a creature.

rulings.text: The “sacrifice a creature” effect is not targeted. It can affect creatures with protection from black, for example.
The player whose turn it is chooses a creature to sacrifice, then each other player in turn order chooses a creature to sacrifice, then all chosen creatures are sacrificed at the same time.

mainBoard.text: When Abyssal Gatekeeper dies, each player sacrifices a creature.

mainBoard.flavorText: To gaze under its hood is to invite death.

mainBoard.originalText:
Flying

mainBoard.flavorText: The imp, unaware of its own odor, paused to catch its breath . . . and promptly died.

mainBoard.originalText:
Flying
When Foul Imp comes into play, you lose 2 life.

rulings.text: You can cast this if you have less than 2 life, since the life is lost as an effect and not a payment.

mainBoard.text:
Flying
When Foul Imp enters the battlefield, you lose 2 life.

mainBoard.name: Kuro, Pitlord
mainBoard.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Kuro, Pitlord unless you pay {B}{B}{B}{B}.
Pay 1 life: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
mainBoard.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Kuro, Pitlord unless you pay {B}{B}{B}{B}.
Pay 1 life: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

mainBoard.flavorText: "My summoning begins your debt, planeswalker."
mainBoard.name: Lord of the Pit
mainBoard.originalText:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature other than Lord of the Pit. If you can't, Lord of the Pit deals 7 damage to you.

rulings.text: If you control any other creatures as Lord of the Pit’s triggered ability resolves, you must sacrifice one. You can’t choose to be dealt 7 damage instead.

If Lord of the Pit has gained lifelink, being dealt 7 damage by it doesn’t cause your life total to change, even though you gain and lose life. If your life total is less than 7, you won’t lose the game.
If you have two Lords of the Pit, you can sacrifice them to each other.

mainBoard.text:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature other than Lord of the Pit. If you can't, Lord of the Pit deals 7 damage to you.

mainBoard.flavorText: Slow and steady may not always win the race, but at least it doesn't end up splattered on the walls.
mainBoard.name: Overeager Apprentice
mainBoard.originalText: Discard a card, Sacrifice Overeager Apprentice: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.
mainBoard.text: Discard a card, Sacrifice Overeager Apprentice: Add {B}{B}{B}.

mainBoard.name: Reiver Demon
mainBoard.originalText:
Flying
When Reiver Demon comes into play, if you played it from your hand, destroy all nonartifact, nonblack creatures. They can't be regenerated.

rulings.text: If a creature (such as Clone) enters the battlefield as a copy of this creature, the copy’s “enters-the-battlefield” ability will still trigger as long as you cast that creature spell from your hand.

mainBoard.text:
Flying
When Reiver Demon enters the battlefield, if you cast it from your hand, destroy all nonartifact, nonblack creatures. They can't be regenerated.

mainBoard.flavorText: "If one gets in your chimney, you're going to need a long wick and a barrel of bangstuff to get it out." —Hob Heddil
mainBoard.name: Soot Imp
mainBoard.originalText:
Flying
Whenever a player plays a nonblack spell, that player loses 1 life.

rulings.text: This ability affects all players, including you.
A hybrid spell that’s black and another color is *not* a nonblack spell. Since it’s black, it can’t be nonblack!

mainBoard.text:
Flying
Whenever a player casts a nonblack spell, that player loses 1 life.

mainBoard.flavorText: Don't drink and thrive.
mainBoard.name: Souldrinker
mainBoard.originalText: Pay 3 life: Put a +1/+1 counter on Souldrinker.
mainBoard.text: Pay 3 life: Put a +1/+1 counter on Souldrinker.

mainBoard.name: Stinkweed Imp
mainBoard.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Stinkweed Imp deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature.
Dredge 5 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly five cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

rulings.text: Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.
Once you decide to replace a draw using a card’s dredge ability, that card can’t be removed from your graveyard “in response.” (Replacement effects don’t use the stack.)
You can’t use dredge unless you’re going to draw a card and the card with dredge is already in your graveyard.
Notably, Stinkweed Imp’s ability isn’t deathtouch. It’s a triggered ability that triggers only on combat damage.

mainBoard.text:
Flying
Whenever Stinkweed Imp deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature.
Dredge 5 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly five cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

mainBoard.flavorText: "In the game of conquest, who cares about the pawns if the king yet reigns?" —Geth, keeper of the Vault
mainBoard.name: Barter in Blood
mainBoard.originalText: Each player sacrifices two creatures.

rulings.text: The active player chooses which creatures will be sacrificed first, then each other player in turn order does the same. Then all creatures are sacrificed simultaneously.
If a player controls only one creature, that creature is sacrificed.
Barter in Blood doesn’t target any creatures and may be cast even if a player controls fewer than two creatures.

mainBoard.text: Each player sacrifices two creatures.

mainBoard.flavorText: "Your blood, your marrow, your spirit—all are mine." —Mayvar, minion of Geth
mainBoard.name: Consume Spirit
mainBoard.originalText:
Spend only black mana on X.
Consume Spirit deals X damage to target creature or player and you gain X life.

rulings.text: The amount of life you gain is equal to the number chosen for X, not the amount of damage Consume Spirit deals (in case some of it is prevented).
If the targeted permanent or player is an illegal target by the time Consume Spirit would resolve, the entire spell doesn’t resolve. You won’t gain any life.

mainBoard.text:
Spend only black mana on X.
Consume Spirit deals X damage to any target and you gain X life.

mainBoard.flavorText: There are things beneath the murk for whom the bog is a stew, a thin broth in need of meat.
mainBoard.name: Corrupt
mainBoard.originalText: Corrupt deals damage equal to the number of Swamps you control to target creature or player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.

rulings.text: The swamps are counted on resolution.
The life you gain is equal to the damage dealt by Corrupt, not necessarily to the number of Swamps you control (if some or all of the damage is prevented, for example).

The amount of damage dealt to a creature is not bounded by its toughness, and the amount of damage dealt to a player is not bounded by that player’s life total. For example, if Corrupt deals 6 damage to a 2/2 creature, you’ll gain 6 life.
Corrupt counts any land you control with the subtype Swamp, not just ones named Swamp.

mainBoard.text: Corrupt deals damage to any target equal to the number of Swamps you control. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.

mainBoard.flavorText: "Choose your next words carefully. They will be your last." —Phage the Untouchable
mainBoard.name: Cruel Edict
mainBoard.originalText: Target opponent sacrifices a creature.
mainBoard.text: Target opponent sacrifices a creature.

mainBoard.flavorText: Liliana learned the secrets she sought, but at a price that was etched on her fate.
mainBoard.name: Demonic Tutor
mainBoard.originalText: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You pick a card on resolution.
You don’t reveal the card to your opponent.
This card is put directly into your hand. It is not drawn.

mainBoard.text: Search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, then shuffle your library.

mainBoard.flavorText: "Change your mind, or I'll change it for you."
mainBoard.name: Duress
mainBoard.originalText: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
mainBoard.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.

mainBoard.name: Promise of Power
mainBoard.originalText:
Choose one — You draw five cards and you lose 5 life; or put a black Demon creature token with flying into play with power and toughness each equal to the number of cards in your hand as the token comes into play.
Entwine {4} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

rulings.text: The power/toughness of the token is set when this spell resolves.
The power and toughness of the Demon token are set when Promise of Power resolves. They’re unaffected if the number of cards in your hand changes later.
If you pay the entwine cost, you draw five cards, then lose five life, then put the Demon token onto the battlefield. The five cards you draw count toward the Demon’s power and toughness.

mainBoard.text:
Choose one —
• You draw five cards and you lose 5 life.
• Create an X/X black Demon creature token with flying, where X is the number of cards in your hand.
Entwine {4} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

mainBoard.flavorText: "Ha, banishment? Be merciful, say 'death,' For exile hath more terror in his look, Much more than death." —William Shakespeare, Romeo and Juliet
mainBoard.name: Dark Banishing
mainBoard.originalText: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
mainBoard.text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

mainBoard.text: Add {B}{B}{B}.

mainBoard.flavorText: Its curve mimics the twists of life and death.
mainBoard.name: Demon's Horn
mainBoard.originalText: Whenever a player plays a black spell, you may gain 1 life.

rulings.text: The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a black spell.
If a player casts a black spell, Demon’s Horn’s ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Demon’s Horn’s ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

mainBoard.text: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may gain 1 life.

mainBoard.flavorText: The thrulls bred at a terrifying pace. In the end, they overwhelmed the Order of the Ebon Hand.
mainBoard.name: Breeding Pit
mainBoard.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Breeding Pit unless you pay {B}{B}.
At the end of your turn, put a 0/1 black Thrull creature token into play.

rulings.text: Breeding Pit must actually be on the battlefield at the beginning of the endstep in order for you to get a Thrull. The getting of the Thrull is not part of paying the upkeep, it is part of having the card on the battlefield.

mainBoard.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Breeding Pit unless you pay {B}{B}.
At the beginning of your end step, create a 0/1 black Thrull creature token.

mainBoard.name: Barren Moor
mainBoard.originalText:
Barren Moor comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
Cycling {B} ({B}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
